ai.summary: A short, easy 3 km woodland loop through Budshead Wood, marked by blue waymarkers. The route is ideal for families, dog walkers, and casual hikers seeking a gentle, shaded stroll in the UK.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly even, compact forest paths with occasional roots and gentle gradients. Expect shaded woodland, damp patches after rain, and well-maintained surfaces suitable for most footwear.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go and wear sturdy walking shoes. Watch for mud, uneven ground, and low-hanging branches. In UK woodlands, ticks can be present; keep to marked paths, check pets and children regularly, and perform a quick tick check after your hike. The route may share paths with cyclists, so stay alert and give way where indicated. Mobile signal can be patchy in deeper woods.
recommended_gear: Map or offline route (or a downloaded map on your phone)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn; suitable year-round in dry, well-maintained conditions.
